message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LO, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.CR

Reasoning: The paper proposes a probabilistic framework for reasoning in modal logics, which is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science. The use of weighted formulas and learning from data suggests a connection to artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The focus on modal logics and the use of Kripke structures suggests a connection to logic and verification (cs.LO). The use of probability distributions and inference algorithms suggests a connection to machine learning (cs.LG) and natural language processing (cs.CL). Finally, the discussion of the case of languages with an infinite number of propositions suggests a connection to cryptography (cs.CR).
